result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan N Rink not in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Ryan N Rink.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised Atty. Drewa that had medical emergency; requests adjournment.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Ryan N Rink in court.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Ryan N Rink.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance, adj for disc and pt. Not guilty plea entered by Court.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with any Fleet Farms in Washington County.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Ryan N Rink appeared by video, in custody at WC Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant states missed court as address is incorrect and did not receive notice.  Defendant referred to State Public Defender.  State requests $200.00 cash bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
